title: Hyundai Venue discounts amount to Rs 85,000 this month
description: Discounts on a number of Hyundai cars have increased in the month of June. As part of Hyundai India’s new discounts campaign, the brand is offering a higher amount of benefits on select models to boost sales. Without further ado, here’s how much you could save on your new Hyundai Venue, i20, Nios, Aura, Verna, Alcazar or Exter. Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to stock availability. Please check with your local dealer for the exact amount. Hyundai Tucson discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 1 lakh Buyers interested in Hyundai's flagship SUV, the Tucson, can avail benefits of up to Rs 1 lakh this June, which an increase of Rs 20,000 over May. The Hyundai Tucson can be had with either a 186hp, 2.0-litre diesel engine, or a 156hp, 2.0-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine. Neither engine gets a manual gearbox option, only torque converter automatics – the diesel has an 8-speed while the petrol has a 6-speed. The top-spec Tucson diesel trim also offers all-wheel drive. Prices currently start at Rs 29.27 lakh and go up to Rs 36.04 lakh. Hyundai Venue discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 85,000 Benefits on the Hyundai Venue compact SUV have increased by Rs 10,000 to a maximum of Rs 85,000 in June. The Venue shares its 1.2-litre petrol and 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine options with the i20, but also gets a 116hp, 1.5-litre diesel engine option. Prices for the Tata Nexon, Kia Sonet, Mahindra XUV 3XO and Skoda Kylaq rival start at Rs 7.94 lakh and go up to Rs 13.97 lakh. Hyundai Nios discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 65,000 Compared to last month, discounts on the Hyundai Grand i10 Nios have decreased by about Rs 15,000 to Rs 65,000. Hyundai’s answer to the Maruti Swift and Tata Tiago, which is available with petrol and CNG options, is priced between Rs 5.98 lakh and Rs 8.62 lakh. The 83hp petrol engine is available with manual and AMT options, while the 69hp CNG version is manual only. Hyundai Alcazar discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 60,000 The Hyundai Alcazar is the Korean brand’s answer to the likes of Tata Safari, MG Hector Plus and Mahindra XUV700. Discounts on Hyundai’s three-row SUV have decreased by Rs 5,000 from last month, with select variants getting up to Rs 60,000 of in June. The Alcazar is currently priced between Rs 14.99 lakh and Rs 21.74 lakh, comes with 160hp, 1.5-litre turbo-petrol and 116hp, 1.5-litre diesel engine options, and was recently updated with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. Hyundai Verna discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 60,000 The Hyundai Verna has up to Rs 60,000 in discounts this month, which is a reduction of about Rs 5,000 over May’s total benefits. Hyundai’s competitor to the Honda City, Skoda Slavia and Volkswagen Virtus, costs Rs 11.07 lakh-17.55 lakh, and is powered by either a 115hp 1.5-litre petrol or a 160hp 1.5-litre turbo-petrol engine; both have manual and automatic gearboxes to choose from. Hyundai i20 discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 55,000 While the exact break-up of the offers are not available – it includes a cash discount, exchange or scrappage benefits, and corporate offers – the Hyundai i20 now gets up to Rs 55,000 off. This represents a reduction of about Rs 10,000 over the discounts available last month. Hyundai’s rival to the Maruti Baleno, Toyota Glanza, and the recently launched Tata Altroz facelift is currently priced from Rs 7.51 lakh to Rs 12.56 lakh; these prices include the sportier N Line variants, which are powered by the 120hp, 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine. All other i20 variants get a 1.2-litre petrol engine that makes 83hp with the manual gearbox and 88hp with the CVT option. Hyundai Exter discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 55,000 Hyundai’s smallest SUV, the Exter, has benefits to the tune of Rs 55,000 this month, which is about Rs 5,000 less than last month. Available with the same 1.2-litre petrol and CNG powertrain options as the Nios, the Hyundai Exter rivals the Tata Punch and the naturally aspirated versions of the Nissan Magnite and Renault Kiger. Exter prices currently range from Rs 6 lakh to 10.51 lakh. Hyundai Aura discounts in June 2025 Save up to Rs 55,000 Discounts on the Hyundai Aura, which rivals the Maruti Dzire and Honda Amaze, are down by about Rs 10,000 compared to last month. The Aura is available in petrol and CNG guises – sharing the same powertrain options with the Nios – and is priced between Rs 6.54 lakh and Rs 9.11 lakh, including the Corporate trim. All prices, ex-showroom, India Also see: 2025 Hyundai Venue spied with Creta like headlights, DRLs Hyundai i20 automatic is now Rs 58,000 cheaper Hyundai India promises 26 launches by FY2030 including 6 EVs

As part of Hyundai’s new benefits campaign, the i20, Verna, Nios, Aura Tucson, Alcazar and Exter also get significant offers in June 2025.

Discounts on a number of Hyundai cars have increased in the month of June. As part of Hyundai India’s new discounts campaign, the brand is offering a higher amount of benefits on select models to boost sales. Without further ado, here’s how much you could save on your new Hyundai Venue, i20, Nios, Aura, Verna, Alcazar or Exter.

Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to stock availability. Please check with your local dealer for the exact amount.

Hyundai Tucson discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 1 lakh

Buyers interested in Hyundai's flagship SUV, the Tucson, can avail benefits of up to Rs 1 lakh this June, which an increase of Rs 20,000 over May. The Hyundai Tucson can be had with either a 186hp, 2.0-litre diesel engine, or a 156hp, 2.0-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine. Neither engine gets a manual gearbox option, only torque converter automatics – the diesel has an 8-speed while the petrol has a 6-speed. The top-spec Tucson diesel trim also offers all-wheel drive. Prices currently start at Rs 29.27 lakh and go up to Rs 36.04 lakh.

Hyundai Venue discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 85,000

Benefits on the Hyundai Venue compact SUV have increased by Rs 10,000 to a maximum of Rs 85,000 in June. The Venue shares its 1.2-litre petrol and 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine options with the i20, but also gets a 116hp, 1.5-litre diesel engine option. Prices for the Tata Nexon, Kia Sonet, Mahindra XUV 3XO and Skoda Kylaq rival start at Rs 7.94 lakh and go up to Rs 13.97 lakh.

Hyundai Nios discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 65,000

Compared to last month, discounts on the Hyundai Grand i10 Nios have decreased by about Rs 15,000 to Rs 65,000. Hyundai’s answer to the Maruti Swift and Tata Tiago, which is available with petrol and CNG options, is priced between Rs 5.98 lakh and Rs 8.62 lakh. The 83hp petrol engine is available with manual and AMT options, while the 69hp CNG version is manual only.

Hyundai Alcazar discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 60,000

The Hyundai Alcazar is the Korean brand’s answer to the likes of Tata Safari, MG Hector Plus and Mahindra XUV700. Discounts on Hyundai’s three-row SUV have decreased by Rs 5,000 from last month, with select variants getting up to Rs 60,000 of in June. The Alcazar is currently priced between Rs 14.99 lakh and Rs 21.74 lakh, comes with 160hp, 1.5-litre turbo-petrol and 116hp, 1.5-litre diesel engine options, and was recently updated with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto.

Hyundai Verna discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 60,000

The Hyundai Verna has up to Rs 60,000 in discounts this month, which is a reduction of about Rs 5,000 over May’s total benefits. Hyundai’s competitor to the Honda City, Skoda Slavia and Volkswagen Virtus, costs Rs 11.07 lakh-17.55 lakh, and is powered by either a 115hp 1.5-litre petrol or a 160hp 1.5-litre turbo-petrol engine; both have manual and automatic gearboxes to choose from.

Hyundai i20 discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 55,000

While the exact break-up of the offers are not available – it includes a cash discount, exchange or scrappage benefits, and corporate offers – the Hyundai i20 now gets up to Rs 55,000 off. This represents a reduction of about Rs 10,000 over the discounts available last month. Hyundai’s rival to the Maruti Baleno, Toyota Glanza, and the recently launched Tata Altroz facelift is currently priced from Rs 7.51 lakh to Rs 12.56 lakh; these prices include the sportier N Line variants, which are powered by the 120hp, 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine. All other i20 variants get a 1.2-litre petrol engine that makes 83hp with the manual gearbox and 88hp with the CVT option.

Hyundai Exter discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 55,000

Hyundai’s smallest SUV, the Exter, has benefits to the tune of Rs 55,000 this month, which is about Rs 5,000 less than last month. Available with the same 1.2-litre petrol and CNG powertrain options as the Nios, the Hyundai Exter rivals the Tata Punch and the naturally aspirated versions of the Nissan Magnite and Renault Kiger. Exter prices currently range from Rs 6 lakh to 10.51 lakh.

Hyundai Aura discounts in June 2025

Save up to Rs 55,000

Discounts on the Hyundai Aura, which rivals the Maruti Dzire and Honda Amaze, are down by about Rs 10,000 compared to last month. The Aura is available in petrol and CNG guises – sharing the same powertrain options with the Nios – and is priced between Rs 6.54 lakh and Rs 9.11 lakh, including the Corporate trim.

All prices, ex-showroom, India
